books.title: Don Quixote
books.author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
books.summary: A mad knight-errant and his down-to-earth squire encounter adventure in the Spanish countryside.

books.title: A High Wind in Jamaica
books.author: Richard Hughes
books.summary: After their parents’ plantation in Jamaica is destroyed by a hurricane, a group of children returning to England are kidnapped by pirates.

books.title: Passages from the Life of a Philosopher
books.author: Charles Babbage
books.summary: The eminent Victorian scientist and mathematician on his inventions, dreams and adventures.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: The Magic City
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: A young boy, upset by his older sister’s recent marriage, builds an imaginary city out of blocks and household items and then finds himself living inside it.

books.title: The Cords of Vanity
books.author: James Branch Cabell
books.summary: An arrogant young author makes his way through a series of love affairs, avoiding every situation that may cause unpleasantness.

books.title: Edward III
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Edward III declares himself the true heir of France, which launches the Hundred Years’ War.

books.title: Peter and Wendy
books.author: J. M. Barrie
books.summary: A mischievous and cocky young boy, Peter Pan, takes Wendy and her brothers on adventures on a fantasy island consisting of mermaids, pirates, Native Americans, and fairies.

books.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective and his companion investigate further crimes and mysteries, culminating in a life-or-death struggle with an evil nemesis.

books.title: The Turn of the Screw
books.author: Henry James
books.summary: A governess moves in to a haunted manor.

books.title: Incidents in the Life of a Slave Girl
books.author: Linda Brent
books.summary: The autobiography of a woman who grew up in, and escaped from, slavery.

books.title: Lady Audley’s Secret
books.author: M. E. Braddon
books.summary: When his friend disappears suddenly in mysterious circumstances, a young, idle barrister feels forced to investigate, even at the peril of destroying the happiness of his beloved uncle.

books.title: Disenchantment
books.author: C. E. Montague
books.summary: A World War I veteran analyzes how the war affected the collective British psyche.

books.title: Principia Ethica
books.author: G. E. Moore
books.summary: An analysis of the concept of good that diagnoses the history of ethics as being marred by the “naturalistic fallacy” while discussing intrinsic goods and evils.

books.title: Magnolia Leaves
books.author: Mary Weston Fordham
books.summary: A collection of poems by Mary Weston Fordham.

books.title: Sunshine Sketches of a Little Town
books.author: Stephen Leacock
books.summary: A humorous account of life in the fictional small town of Mariposa.

books.title: First Lensman
books.author: E. E. Smith
books.summary: Virgil Samms, the first individual to receive a Lens from the mysterious and powerful Arisians, works to create the Galatic Patrol to protect all adherents of Civilization from the threat of the Boskonians and their masters, the Eddorians.

books.title: Lord Arthur Savile’s Crime and Other Stories
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A collection of Oscar Wilde’s short mysteries.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: Journals
books.author: Alexander Mackenzie
books.summary: Explorer Alexander Mackenzie details his journeys to both the Arctic and Pacific Oceans in his personal journals.
